    • Method Detail

      • isJaxb2Present

        public static boolean isJaxb2Present(ClassLoader classLoader)
        Determine whether a JAXB binder is present on the classpath and can be loaded. Will return false if either the Binder or one of its dependencies is not present or cannot be loaded.
        Parameters:
        classLoader - classLoader
        Returns:
        isJaxb2Present

      • isJackson2Present

        public static boolean isJackson2Present(ClassLoader classLoader)
        Determine whether Jackson 2.x is present on the classpath and can be loaded. Will return false if either the com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper, com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator or one of its dependencies is not present or cannot be loaded.
        Parameters:
        classLoader - classLoader
        Returns:
        isJackson2Present

      • isJacksonPresent

        @Deprecated
public static boolean isJacksonPresent(ClassLoader classLoader)
        Deprecated. 
        Determine whether Jackson 1.x is present on the classpath and can be loaded. Will return false if either the org.codehaus.jackson.map.ObjectMapper, org.codehaus.jackson.JsonGenerator or one of its dependencies is not present or cannot be loaded.
        Parameters:
        classLoader - classLoader
        Returns:
        isJacksonPresent

      • defaultHttpMessageConverters

        public static List<org.springframework.http.converter.HttpMessageConverter<?>> defaultHttpMessageConverters(org.springframework.core.env.PropertyResolver propertyResolver,
                                                                                                            Object objectMapper)
        Returns default HttpMessageConverter instances, i.e.:
        • ByteArrayHttpMessageConverter
        • StringHttpMessageConverter
        • ResourceHttpMessageConverter
        • Jaxb2RootElementHttpMessageConverter (when JAXB is present)
        • MappingJackson2HttpMessageConverter (when Jackson 2.x is present)
        • {org.springframework.http.converter.json.MappingJacksonHttpMessageConverter} (when Jackson 1.x is present and 2.x not)

        Note: It does not return all of the default converters defined in Spring, but just thus usable for exception responses.

        Parameters:
        propertyResolver - propertyResolver
        objectMapper - objectMapper
        Returns:
        httpMessageConverters

      • defaultContentNegotiationManager

        public static org.springframework.web.accept.ContentNegotiationManager defaultContentNegotiationManager()
